bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.summary: Compiler error 2.4.3 in iOS 6.0 when using Stitcher class
bug.description:
Transferred from <denchmark-link:http://code.opencv.org/issues/2503>http://code.opencv.org/issues/2503</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>|| Christopher Herbon on 2012-11-05 09:17 || Priority: Normal || Affected: None || Category: ios || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: None || PR: None || Platform: None / None </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Compiler error 2.4.3 in iOS 6.0 when using Stitcher class</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>I have posted this in the questions section before, but I believe this is some sort of bug. Whenever I try to use the Stitcher class in iOS 6.0 (Xcode 4.5.2) and I include the stitcher header file ( @#include <opencv2/stitching/stitcher.hpp@>) after including the actual opencv header, I end up with a compile error @Expected '{'@ in @exposure_compensate.hpp@. Apparently the line @enum { NO, GAIN, GAIN_BLOCKS };@ is causing some sort of error. When I comment that line it works fine. The same holds true for the line @enum { NO, FEATHER, MULTI_BAND };@ in @blenders.hpp@. I am not including sample code, because including the stitcher.hpp header file causes the compiler error. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>
